title: David’s Census and the Plague
summary: David orders a census, an act of pride and mistrust in God, resulting in a plague. After realizing his sin, David repents. God stops the plague after David builds an altar on the future temple site.

faq.question: Why was the census a sin?
faq.answer: It showed David’s reliance on numbers and military strength rather than God.

faq.question: How did God stop the plague?
faq.answer: David built an altar and offered sacrifices at the threshing floor of Araunah, where the plague ended.
